ygData.subject: RE: Nagafen 2; Sylly 0
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, I m not going to argue this with you.  We obviously play for different reasons and have fun in different ways.  However, the tips that I listed for
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, I'm not going to argue this with you. We obviously play for different
reasons and have fun in different ways. However, the tips that I listed for
reducing client side lags were not for you Harmonic, they were for the list
in general as advice on what to do on their first dragon raid. There are
other people on this list that could benefit from advice other than "Don't
go until you're 49, I wouldn't let you anyhow if I had my way."

I've never said or felt that you were an idiot, but I have noticed in recent
weeks that your attitude toward other players whos level hasn't caused them
a nosebleed (under 49 apparently) has deteriorated.

Crier

> > No disrespect Harmonic, but what is it about level 50 that
> > makes players so elitist?
>
> I never went on dragon raids when I was younger, and for a reason.
> I've already stated that reason. Now, I've waited to do this and
> I see why it's important to do so. We will not be taking anyone
> less than L49 on any further raids, you have to play elite to beat
> a more elite opponent. I'm sorry you felt downplayed.
>
> > Harmonic, don't forget that although the songs at higher levels have
> > improved, our percussion skills are already maxxed at 41. Our
> party buffing
> > abilities (other than perhaps by new songs) aren't going to improve.
>
> Then you don't understand your songs well enough. At L50 a bard
> can produce 9 more MR/CR/FR with elemental than a L41 bard, regardless
> of precussion skill.
>
> Nothing new.
> Nothing new.
> Nothing new, etc. I will not go on.
>
> You are assuming I'm a complete idiot when it comes to lag. Let
> me help you out here... There is visual lag (all the crap you are
> stating) and there is server lag. The location server cannot keep
> pace with 50 or 60 people standing in one place. It never has,
> even in beta. Verant simply hasn't designed the game to accomodate
> that. I do not get visual lag. I get server lag. In fact, to
> the point where I completely crash.
>
> > Reduce resolution if applicable. I normally play at 1024x768 on a TNT2
> > Ultra, but reduce to 800x600 for dragons.
>
> I have a Diamond V770 TNT2 Ultra, at 640 x 480. and??? heh
>
> I don't mean to sound harsh, but you've opened yourself up here
> based on your semi-limited knowledge of myself and my computer
> and my tactics. Sorry I wasn't more clear in the beginning.
> You've stated nothing new to me here.
>
> Harm.
